ContentStructure.title: By the end of this lesson you should be able to:  Define and describe key concepts in design-mood, function, harmony and visual weight.  Describe the design process and its components. Discuss the steps in interviewing a client and be able to collect adequate information for the project to be successful.  How to educate/expose the client to alternatives.
Eye of a Designer - What to Look For
The beginning point in designing any successful room is knowing what to look for. Successful rooms:

A successful room is functional.  The staring point in all good rooms, is to decide in advance what functions the room is to fulfill. This is the first question you must answer when planning the interior for any room.

What is the basic function of a living room?  The basic function of a living room is that it should be conducive to friendly conversation.  The furniture layout and other elements of the interior design should support this goal.
Observe how all the chairs are arranged to face each other so a large group can sit and talk together.  There is also opportunity for a couple of people to have a more intimate conversation.

Can a room have more than one function?  Here are two settings highlighted that would be appropriate for reading - in either of the two chairs near the window, or at the far end of the sofa on the right.
Another function of the living room is to entertain.  There are many different functions a room may have to fulfill.
Mood refers to the general look or feeling you want a room to express.
In a successful room all elements must work together in total harmony. This means that all should feel appropriate and none should seem out of place.
Colors must also be in harmony
Harmony refers to the appropriateness of all the elements in your interior designs.
Colors must also be in harmony
Identify the simple guidelines that will become the foundation of every successfulinterior that a designer will create. Choose all that apply and click Submit.
A successful room expresses a mood.

answer.title: A successful room expresses a mood.

ContentStructure.title: A successful room exhibits a sense of harmony.

answer.title: A successful room exhibits a sense of harmony.

answer.title: A successful room is full of color.

ContentStructure.title: A young professional couple, Rakesh and Ramya move to a posh but small NY city apartment. It is a single bedroom apartment with a large living room with an open kitchen.  Ramya loves to fix dinners at home and Rakesh usually needs to work on his laptop after coming home in the evenings.  They both work out on their treadmill at different times in the morning since they wake up at different times.
What functions need to be kept in mind while designing the living room of the apartment? Choose all that apply and click Submit.
Incorrect - All functions need to be kept in mind.Click Next to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

ContentStructure.title: A room works when all the elements - furniture, accessories, fabrics, and colors - fit together harmoniously.

Function refers to the practicality of a piece of furniture.  Will the piece do the job you want it to do? Can you afford it within your budget?  Check that the furniture you are choosing fulfills the intended function.  Cost is the other aspect of function.  If you can't afford it in the budget you can't use it.
Dont fall in love with pieces if you cant afford them in the budget.
Eliminate from consideration all pieces not suitable based on the mood and style you are looking for.
Is a piece of furniture suitable in mood?
Is a piece of furniture suitable in style?
When you decide if a piece of furniture is suitable in function and cost, you should also consider if it is suitable in mood and style.
Let's now consider mood. In evaluating furniture, subdivide \
into two aspects:
When evaluating furniture you should consider harmony which is subdivided into three criteria:
Suitability of quality means that every piece you select should be harmonious in quality with all the other furniture and furnishings in the room.
A second aspect of harmony that you want to consider is proportion. Each piece of furniture you select should be suitable in its proportions.
The slender legs look to delicate for the heavy tabletop. You don't have to be an expert to feel this way.
The legs are too rugged for the delicate tabletop. Again, the parts of this table are out of proportion to each other.
How do you feel about this table? Does it look right?
What do you think of this table? Does it look right?
Proportion is the relationship of one part of an object to its other parts.
The top is delicate and so are the legs. They are harmonious in their proportions.
Dont you find that the legs and the top are in better proportion to each other?
The legs and the top are in proportion to each other. They also work together harmoniously.
Harmony of Proportion and the Proportion Test
In the figure below you see the same lamp base with three different shades (A,B,C).Which of these shades \
best with the base to produce a well-proportioned lamp?
Shade A is too small for the base, isnt it?
The base and shade are out of proportion to each other.
Shade B is too large for the base, isnt it?
Again, you can feel that the base and shade are out of proportion to each other.
Shade C appears about right for the base, doesnt it?
Its size works well with the size of the base. You instinctively feel that the shade and the base are in good proportion to each other.

What is the Proportion Test?   Look at the different dimensions of a piece of furniture and ask yourself if you find them pleasing. Consider the height, width, and depth. Are they in a pleasing relationship with one another? The table legs with the table top? The lamp base with the lampshade? The chair seat with the chair arms?    If you find the various dimensions pleasing, then the piece has passed the Proportion Test. If you dont, then dont use the piece.

Is this piece suitable in Function and Cost? Will it do the job and fit within budget? Choose the appropriate selection and click Submit.

ContentStructure.title: In the figure at left you see two lamps, Lamp A and Lamp B. They are the same height, but do they have the same visual weight?
Suppose you want to flank these lamps on either side of a sofa, as illustrated in this figure. Do they balance each other? Choose Yes or No and click Submit.
Incorrect - The answer is Yes. Click Next to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Knowledge Check
question.text: Suppose you want to flank these lamps on either side of a sofa, as illustrated in this figure. Do they balance each other? Choose Yes or No and click Submit.

ContentStructure.title: The sofa with a pair of identical lamps, as shown in the figure. This type of arrangement is an example of what is called formal balance. You have formal balance when one side of a grouping is a mirror-image of the other side.
In this figure you have achieved what is called informal balance - that is, the grouping is in visual balance even though the two sides are not identical.

In the figure below you see two chairs. If you measure these two chairs, you will find that they have exactly the same dimensions --the same width, height, and depth. So, their size is the same. But what about their visual weight?
One chair has heavier visual weight than the other.
If you want to use these two chairs in an informally balanced setting, you couldnt  simply place them opposite each other, as  in this figure at left.
One aspect of visual weight is the shape of the object.
You could place other objects alongside the lighter chair to add weight to its side of the grouping, for example, the table and lamp as in the figure at right.
In the figure you see a grouping with a pair of identical chairs. Clearly, they are in balance.
A bright color makes an object stand out. It adds visual weight to the object. A muted color makes an object look smaller. It reduces the visual weight of the object.
In the figure you see a grouping with a pair of identical chairs. Clearly, they are in balance.
What is the practical effect of adding color?
Bright, intense colors add visual weight.
Muted or neutral colors reduce visual weight.
If you want to achieve balance between two different-sized pieces of furniture, you can \
to the smaller piece by finishing it in a bright or intense color. Conversely, you can reduce the visual weight of the larger piece by finishing it is a muted or neutral color.
A bright color makes an object stand out. It adds visual weight to the object. A muted color makes an object look smaller. It reduces the visual weight of the object.
From these illustrations you can see that a bold pattern makes a piece appear visually heavier. Bold patterns add visual weight. Solid colors or simple patterns reduce visual weight.
The chairs are identical except for the patterned upholstery on one of the chairs.
Consider the feeling of this figure where both chairs have the same bold-patterned upholstery. Now they feel back in balance because they are both visually heavier.
Keep the following objectives in mind when selecting furniture:
Every piece of furniture you select should be harmonious in scale to the size of the room.
Every piece should be harmonious in scale to the size of the other pieces in its setting.
You measure a piece of furniture in terms of its visual weight.
An objects's visual weight will be influenced by it's shape, color and pattern.
The first consideration while selecting furniture is to relate the scale of the most important piece of furniture to the size of the room. Big rooms can handle big furniture.

A big room can handle furniture that features intense color and bold patterns. A big room calls for big architectural features. The architectural elements of a room should be in scale to the size of the room.
Small rooms generally appear more in scale with furniture and architectural details that are on the smaller side.
Furniture in a small room should be visually \
. Use quieter colors and less bold patterns.
The architectural features of a small room should be scaled to the size of the room.

The bed is too big for the room.

How to Develop Your Sense of Good Design
By training your eye! You train your eye by looking at good furniture. In other words, you develop your sense of taste by looking at - and studying - examples of good furniture design.
How do you learn to recognize good proportion?
How do you develop your sense of taste?
How do you develop refined ability?
How to Develop Your Sense of Good Design
Where do you find such examples of good furniture design?

Dont just look at good furniture. Examine it. Study it. Analyze it. Ask yourself: What makes this piece work? What do I like about this piece? What dont I like? How do I feel about the proportions of this piece?

Lets assume that youve been hired by Roopa and Rohith to decorate a few rooms in their home. Their bare living room is as you see in the illustration here.  Youve been hired by the Rohiths to transform this bare space into a beautiful, exciting, functional living room.   Youre going to have to decide upon a furniture layout for this room and choose a color scheme.   Youre going to have to select fabrics, flooring materials, window treatments, and lighting.

The starting point of the Design Process is to meet the Rohiths, talk to them, and ask them questions that will give you the information you need to go ahead.  Your aim is to design an environment in which they will be comfortable. To do so, you must find out enough about them to successfully achieve three objectives -- Design a room that:  Functions in a way that satisfies their lifestyle.  Expresses a mood in which they will feel comfortable.  Create an environment in which all the elements fit together in harmony

The starting point of the Design Process is to meet the Rohiths, talk to them, and ask them questions that will give you the information you need to go ahead.  Your aim is to design an environment in which they will be comfortable. To do so, you must find out enough about them to successfully achieve three objectives -- Design a room that:  Functions in a way that satisfies their lifestyle. Expresses a mood in which they will feel comfortable. Create an environment in which all the elements fit together in harmony
It said that before you start to design a room, you must define the functions of the room.

The starting point of the Design Process is to meet the Rohiths, talk to them, and ask them questions that will give you the information you need to go ahead.  Your aim is to design an environment in which they will be comfortable. To do so, you must find out enough about them to successfully achieve three objectives -- Design a room that:  Functions in a way that satisfies their lifestyle. Expresses a mood in which they will feel comfortable. Create an environment in which all the elements fit together in harmony
It said that before you start to design a room, you must define the mood of the room.

First step  You are going to meet with Roopa and Rohith.   What questions should you ask?  You have to find out how they intend to use each room you are to design.  Ask the following questions: How big is their family? Do they have children? If so, how many, and what are their ages? Do they have a dog? A cat? Do they entertain a lot? Is their style at home - formal or informal?

First step  You are going to meet with Roopa and Rohith.   What questions should you ask?  You have to find out how they intend to use each room you are to design.  Ask the following questions: How big is their family? Do they have children? If so, how many, and what are their ages? Do they have a dog? A cat? Do they entertain a lot? Is their style at home - formal or informal?
It said that all the elements in your design scheme should work together in harmony.
The desire to decorate a room is a vague notion in the client's mind, something like:
Your starting point will be to fill out the NYIAD Lifestyle Questionnaire, which covers 3 important aspects of the job:
I know that I want the room to look different from before, but Im not sure what I want.
I know that I want, but I am not sure how to put all together.

As you can see the Lifestyle Questionnaire contains a fairly long list of questions that you will want to cover with the Rohiths. Most of these questions require more than a yes-or-no answer.  Point out to the Rohiths that just as they would be honest with their doctor, so they should be honest with you.

Your attitude is important Make it clear that your relationship with the client is totally confidential and that you will not divulge any of the information they share with you.  The secret to a successful interview The secret to successfully completing this Lifestyle Questionnaire  is to establish a relaxed, cordial, friendly atmosphere during the interview.  Get your clients relaxed Get them talking about themselves, about how they live and about how they want to live. Clients can't analyze their own needs by just filling out the Questionnaire - they need you!  When  to start the Questionnaire? Only after you come to a fairly solid understanding based on conversation with your clients should you start completing the questionnaire.
Where Should You Conduct the Interview
By visiting their home you immediately learn a great deal about them.
It usually permits you to examine the room or rooms on which you will be working.
It has the added advantage of setting up an atmosphere for the meeting that is comfortable for them and conducive to a more open discussion.

Regardless of where you hold the interview - set a time limit.  The Lifestyle Questionnaire will enable you to accumulate and absorb all the necessary information ins a systematic, thorough and professional way.  If the Robiths ask for your ideas as an Interior Designer:  Before you leave, make an appointment to come back to their home and measure and sketch the room. Be professional - in a friendly way. Be friendly - in a professional way.

ContentStructure.title: Interior Designer Tanisha, goes to the Arya family's residence near Mumbai. It is a contemporary villa, for which the kitchen, family room, living room and master bedroom needs to be given a facelift. The designer meets the Aryas couple the first time and is taken around to these spaces.  Tanisha sits for an elaborate interview with the clients, and starts noting down the general mood existing in the house, the number of people in the house, their hobbies, if they like entertaining guests during holidays, how many cooks in the kitchen, color preferences and also asks about the budget the clients plan for the design. The clients are very friendly and make the designer comfortable. With all the information, she schedules the next appointment and leaves.
Do you think that the Interior Designer, Tanisha, followed the first step in the design process?  Choose the best answer and click Submit.
Incorrect - Answer is Yes.Click Next to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

ContentStructure.title: In this lesson, you have learned that: Mood refers to the general look or feeling you want a room to express.  Harmony refers to the appropriateness of all the elements in your interior designs. The elements that constitutes to harmonious are mood, scale, quality and color.  The elements that constitutes to harmonious are mood, scale, quality and color.  To choose furniture intelligently rely upon the three Guidelines you learned earlier-function, mood, and harmony.  Function refers to the practicality of a piece of furniture.  Cost is the other aspect of function. If you cant afford it in the budget, you cant use it. Harmony is subdivided into three criteria-suitability of quality, suitability of proportion, and suitability of scale. Proportion is the relationship of one part of an object to its other parts. The starting point of the Design Process is to meet with the client, talk to them, and ask them questions that will give you the information you need to go ahead. Clients home is the best place to conduct the clients interview.  The Lifestyle Questionnaire will enable you to accumulate and absorb all the necessary information in a systematic, thorough, and professional way.
